articles.author: Abigail Ng
articles.title: Asia-Pacific stocks rise despite China's factory and services activity contracting - CNBC
articles.description: Shares in the Asia-Pacific were mostly higher on Monday as China factory activity missed expectations, and as the market looks ahead to the U.S. Fed meeting this week.

articles.title: President's Star Charity 2022 raises record-breaking S$13m at end of live show - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: Mediacorp’s flagship fundraiser show on Sunday (Oct 30) featured stars like Ellie Goulding, Eric Chou, Aina Abdul, Taufik Batisah and Sylvester Sim.
articles.content: All proceeds from PSC 2022 will aid the 82 benefitting organisations backed by the Presidents Challenge, including Club HEAL (Hope, Empowerment, Acceptance & Love); Very Special Arts, which is de… [+971 chars]

articles.title: Macao's MGM Cotai casino locked down after dealer infected with COVID-19 - CNA
articles.description: HONG KONG: Macao's MGM Cotai, operated by MGM China, was locked down on Sunday (Oct 30) morning after a dealer was found to be infected with COVID-19, local gaming publication Inside Asian Gaming reported, citing unidentified sources. MGM did not immediately …

articles.title: The woman behind Chokmah's candy-coloured trays has had an equally colourful career - Channel NewsAsia
articles.description: Joyce Orallo was an interior designer and then a flight stewardess. She was even going to become a minister. Today, she makes home accessories and runs a successful business based on a groundbreaking material that can be recast over and over. Find out more in…
articles.content: Thirty-five-year-old Joyce Orallo has an interesting CV. After graduating from the LASALLE College of the Arts, she worked as an interior designer but at her mother's advice, changed careers and beca… [+1987 chars]

articles.title: The cost of Laos' quest to be Southeast Asia's 'battery', and the World Heritage town at risk - CNA
articles.description: Laos, which bet big on hydropower to draw foreign investment, supplies electricity to several countries but is swimming in a sea of debt. A dam near its ancient capital has become another cause for worry, the programme Insight finds out.
articles.content: We have to use our natural resources to bring more prosperity, he said, adding that hydropower development has also helped directly to increase the electrification rate from about 30 per cent before … [+684 chars]
